We have the following problem with qooxdoo tables:
How to reproduce: =================
Assume we have >>> var table = ...; // qx.ui.table.Table >>> var model = ...; // qx.ui.table.model.Simple and model contains some data.
Let's click on some cell in table (e.g. row=0, col=0)
Then, some code (e.g. button "execute" handler) updates the table model with >>> model.setData([]) >>> model.setData([["name"]])
After that this very same cell exists (row=0, col=0), but can't be edited!
Diagnosis: ==========
The problem is that >>> qx.ui.table.pane.Scroller.onTableModelDataChanged does reset focused cell to (null, null), but >>> qx.ui.table.Table._updateTableData does not.
So, later on, on mouse click events on the cell (0, 0) >>> qx.ui.table.Table.setFocusedCell gets called with col=0, row=0 and doesn't get past this check >>> if (!this.isEditing() && (col != this.__focusedCol || row != this.__focusedRow)) >>> qx.ui.table.pane.Scroller.setFocusedCell is never called until you click on other cells.
